numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I thank all students who responded.
2. We had many terrific headlines this week.
3. Here are some student headlines.
4. These headlines captured the main idea of the graph.
5. Sky is a student from Iowa.
6. The headline by Sky is "Inherited Admission to Elite Colleges".
7. Katherine is a student from Academy of Saint Elizabeth in Morristown in New Jersey.
8. The headline by Katherine is "College: The Legacy of a Rich Man’s World!".
9. Perth Amboy High School is in New Jersey.
10. Santiago is a student from Perth Amboy High School in New Jersey.
11. The headline by Santiago is "Nepotism at Ivy, Advantages Not Even Money Could Buy!".
12. Emily is a student from Perth Amboy High School in New Jersey.
13. The headline by Emily is "The Legacy Continues, The Gap Widens".
14. Alyson Lu is a student from California.
15. The headline by Alyson Lu is "Are You Rich? Are You a Legacy? Welcome to Harvard!".
16. Texas is a student from Pewaukee High School in Wisconsin.
17. The headline by Texas is "Who's Applying: You or Your Parents?".
18. Seth is a student from Traverse City West Senior High School in Michigan.
19. The headline by Seth is "Data Shows Elite Colleges Who Preach ‘Equity’ Still Favor Legacies and the Upper Class".
20. Molly is a student from Gull Lake High School in Richland in Michigan.
21. The headline by Molly is "No Legacy, No Money, No Luck: Bias in College Admissions".
22. Cameron is a student from Gull Lake High School in Richland in Michigan.
23. The headline by Cameron is "Ivy League or Legacy League".
24. Maxwell is a student from Richland in Michigan.
25. The headline by Maxwell is "College Admissions Skewed: The Effects of Income and Legacy".
26. Aidan is a student from Michigan.
27. The headline by Aidan is "What Are Colleges Really Looking for in an Application: Rich Legacy Parents!".
28. Henry is a student from Michigan.
29. The headline by Henry is "Wealth and Legacy: Is This Mainly What Admissions Care About?".
